content: ¼ 2 ½ repeat row 1 one more time turn the heel row 1 right side k15 16 17 18 19 sts k2tog k1 turn row 2 sl1 purlwise p5 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 knitwise k6 k2tog k1 turn row 4 sl1 purlwise p7 p2tog p1 turn row 5 sl1 knitwise k8 k2tog k1 turn continue working this pattern by working one more stitch before the decrease on each row until all of the stitches have been worked your last decrease row will be a purl row knit one more row you will have 16 16 18 18 20 sts remaining on the needle gusset using your free needle pick up and k14 14 16 18 20 sts down the left side of the heel combine the sts on the next two needles by slipping them onto one needle there should be 26 28 30 32 34 sts on this needle needle two on needle two knit all sts using your free needle pick up and k14 14 16 18 20 sts up the right side of the heel with this same needle k8 8 9 9 10 from the needle with the heel sts on it slip the remaining sts from the heel needle onto the first needle you should have 22 22 25 27 30 sts on the first and third needles you should have 26 28 30 32 34 sts on the second needle section 3 instep row 1 needle one k to last 3 sts on needle k2tog k1 one stitch decreased needle two knit all sts needle three k1 ssk k to end of needle one stitch decreased copyright 2019 yarn café creations christy houghton vanilla frosting by christy houghton 4 row 2 needle one k to end of needle needle two k all sts needle three k to end of needle repeat row 1 and 2 of instep until there are 13 14 15 16 17 sts on needles one and three and 26 28 30 32 34 sts on needle two section 4 the foot row 1 k all sts *you can place a removable progress keeper at the beginning of row one to make it easier to measure your progress as you knit i recommend keeping the progress keepers on your first sock until you complete your second sock in order to match the length of sock one to sock two repeat row one for 4 5 5 0 5 5 6 0 6 5 section 5 the toe row 1 needle one k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle two k1 ssk k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle three k1 ssk k to end four stitches decreased *you can place a removable progress keeper at the beginning of row one to make it easier to keep track of where you started your toe this will come in handy when knitting your second sock i recommend keeping the progress keepers on your first sock until you complete
